itemLabel: Ian Fraser, Baron Fraser of Lonsdale

wikipedia_page.main:
William Jocelyn Ian Fraser, Baron Fraser of Lonsdale,  (30 August 1897 – 19 December 1974), known as Ian Fraser, was a British Conservative Party politician, a Governor of the BBC, a successful businessman and the first person to be awarded a life peerage under the Life Peerages Act 1958.
Fraser was blinded in World War I and became Chairman of St Dunstan's, a charity for blind servicemen.

response: *Ian Fraser, Baron Fraser of Lonsdale (1897–1974) – World War I veteran, who lost his eyesight at the Somme; Chairman of St Dunstan's Charity; MP; BBC Governor; first Life Peer
* Ian Fraser, Baron Fraser of Lonsdale (1897–1974), British politician and businessman
*Ian Fraser, Baron Fraser of Lonsdale or William Jocelyn Ian Fraser (1897–1974), British politician and chairman of St Dunstan's
* Ian Fraser, Baron Fraser of Lonsdale, MP several times between 1924 and 1958, then first life peer appointed to the House of Lords in 1958 (blinded in action during the First World War)
